name: Arbel Suites Hotel

reviews.text: situated in a quiet neighborhood just off dizengoff near ben gurion (10 minutes to the beach), the location of this hotel could not be better. It has a very homy feel...a rotating cast of 5 or 6 staff all seem like owners and family, although it's clear that is only the case amongst 2 or 3 of them. There are free bicycles for use to get around town, good air conditioning and televisions, nice kitchenettes with hotplate, microwave and water kettle, stylish showers and spacious rooms.
reviews.title: spectacular location, nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the downside, the place is renovating...while they do a good job to limit that to the hours of 10 or 11 to 2 or 3 each day, it would have been nice to be informed of that in advance, particularly given that the place is not cheap. I stayed first on the cusp of the high season (expensive) and then considered, but chose not to extend my stay during the high season (VERY expensive). While really a nice stay, I feel it is a bit overpriced for the kind of service/quality that one would expect of a Springfield Suites or Holiday Inn Express type place in the USA.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: overall a nice stay in a spectacular location, with lovely staff.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: When we stayed at the Arbel Hotel there were renovations going on. Perhaps therefore we received a free upgrade. During the day there was quite a bit of noise because of it, but this ended around 5 pm. At night everything was very quiet, although the walls of the rooms are quite thin. The room we stayed in was quite large and we enjoyed our stay. The kitchen was great, but there is only one electronic cooker. The hotel has free bicycles which you can use, so a ride to the beach or Dizengoff center takes only 5 minutes. Old Jaffa is around 5 km away, but still a nice ride along the beach. The location is great in comparison to the sea. Wifi is free and available in the room. All in all a nice stay!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay here every time we visit Tel-Aviv so it feels like our "home away from home."
reviews.title: Excellent location-responsive staff

reviews.text: Basic average accomodations, nothing fancy, rooms include small kitchenette. Very clean, with housekeeping. You can also pay extra for laundry service.
reviews.title: simple, very friendly and helpful

reviews.text: They were doing rennovations during the day, but once we got back to our room late afternoon, it was quiet.
reviews.title: Really nice -- the staff made the best out of a bad situation!

reviews.text: They offer on-site parking at a nominal extra cost, which is a huge asset for those of us who use a car during our stay.
reviews.title: great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, which is walking distance to Dizengoff cafes, shops and Old Port.
reviews.title: very good apartment hotel

reviews.text: This is an owner operated complex. The owners are caring and very intent on a positive experience for all guests. When we arrived, we were speaking to the taxi driver for a while. Concerned that there was a problem, the owner came out to offer assistance. As we entered the lobby, she gave us all tall glasses of fresh cold water....hospitality A+. The rooms are very clean, and neat as a pin. Owner and her son always on premises to assure a positive experience. Beautiful stained glass on the doors and lamps are all owners own handiwork. All in all a wonderful place to stay, and very convenient to beach, buses and general walks. Would definately comeback and send friends. Only downside...no breakfast area..
reviews.title: wonderful experience highly recommend

reviews.text: Very convenient location, once you find it. A block from Dizengoff St. and walking distance to the beach. A number of cafes and 24 hour markets close by. Rooms are newly renovated and comfortable. Housekeeping is thorough and efficient. Laundry service is offered at a modest cost. Parking is available at a daily fee. Bicycles are loaned out at no cost.Attractive covered patio in front with chairs and tables where you can sit and have coffee/tea, complete with a nice running fountain that will soon have fish. The staff is attentive and someone is at the front desk 24/7 to buzz you in. Good value for the money. Only criticism is that they are a bit hung up on wanting to provide only one key card per room. It took some arguing to get a second.
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have recently visited this hotel twice - once for a family vacation and once just with my wife.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In both cases we were very pleased.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great - on a very quite street just 2 minutes walk from Dizengof and Ben-Gurion streets.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arbel was like being at home. The staff was very helpful giving us maps and pointing out where to go, supplying towels for the beach and even milk for our coffee! Having the bikes availabloe was an added plus! The rooms were clean and comfortable with great amenities. We paid double for another hotel and the amenities were not included! Cleanliness, great staff, location and price gives unbeatable value for anyone wanting to enjoy Tel Aviv. We actually had two rooms at Arbel. One for a friend and one for ourselves. My friend's room was smaller than ours, and so was the price, yet adequately supplied. It was obvious the hotel was in the midst of upgrading and the changes we saw were wonderful improvements. When we return, we will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Arbel Hotel great for the budget conscious!

reviews.text: This is an apartment hotel, so no meals are served. You have a small kitchen so make your own breakfast and other meals, otherwise there are lots of restaurants nearby. Location is very central. It´s a small place with friendly owners and staff. You can normally borrow a bicycle for free which is great for Tel Aviv. The price seemed high to me but Tel Aviv is an expensive city and when compared to other places it looked very reasonable.
reviews.title: Friendly place, good location

reviews.text: we are a couple looking for nice quiet places all around the world and we are veey satisfied with the one week staying at arbel suites hotel. the personel was just nice, room accurate and location one of the best. thanks a lot arbel suites.
reviews.title: beautiful week in tel aviv thanks to you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel not easily to find. Good distance to walk to the beach and in town. Quiet place withrestaurants and bars in the streets nearby. No breakfast.
reviews.title: hidden hotel in midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we walked in the staff were friendly and helpful. I had messed up our reservation and they got things straightened out right away for us. Then they provided us with maps and gave great info about our surroundings and suggestions of where to go for groceries, food, drinks etc. They provide free bikes and towels to take to the beach. After our experiences with unfriendly staff in other hotels, the friendly staff would have been sufficient for me to be inspired to write a good review, but when we saw how beautiful and clean the rooms are, I knew I had to get on here right away and give them props!
reviews.title: Best place we've stayed in Israel so far!

description: Arbel Suites Hotel is right in the heart of Tel Aviv's shopping district around Dizengoff Street, a 10-minute walk from the beach. Apartments feature air conditioning and free Wi-Fi.Each apartment at Arbel comes with satellite TV and a fully equipped kitchen. Laundry, fax, and photocopying services are available, and a high chair and baby bathtub are provided upon request.Bikes are free at Arbel Suites and are a great way to explore Tel Aviv. Rabin Square, the largest public square in Tel Aviv, is only 10 minutes away on foot. Breakfast is served at a café 100 metres from the property.
